title.native: 爆転シュート　ベイブレード

description:
Thirteen-year-old Tyson Granger (Takao Kinomiya), along with his fellow teammates, Kai Hiwatari, Max Tate (Max Mizuhura), and Ray Kon (Rei Kon), strive to become the greatest Beybladers in the world. With the technical help of the team's resident genius, Kenny (Kyouju), and with the powerful strength of their BitBeasts, the Bladebreakers armed with their tops (AKA: Blades) attempt to reach their goal.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.yoshihisahirano.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Hirano_comp)

Studied composing at Juilliard School in 1992, and later at Eastman School of Music. Some of the awards he has received include first prize in the Axia Tape Competition in Japan during his high school years and New York's New Music for Young Ensembles. He has composed music for concert, dance, film and radio with compositions ranging from classical to pop and contemporary music. In recent years he has composed a number of anime soundtracks. He has also made music for Tokyo DisneySea's 2002 and 2004 countdown celebrations.    

Hirano has paired with pianist Masako Hosoda to form the unit Bleu and released two albums. He is also responsible for some of the orchestration and arrangement for a number of Ali Project's albums.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

Giorgio Vincenzo Vanni is an Italian singer and song-writer.  Vanni is well known for performing theme songs of Italian dubs of Japanese and American animated TV series.   The dubbed Italian songs he sings usually are not covers of the Japanese songs but tend to be newly written songs for the Italian dub of the anime.   (Source: Wikipedia)

A Brazillian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, singer, and reciter, Mauro Ramos has been on the voice acting business since the 15th of March, 1989.
His most recognizable roles in anime are Old Joseph Joestar (Jojo's), Jet Black (Cowboy Bebop) and Alex Louis Armstrong (FullMetal Alchemist: Brotherhood).
Stefan Berglund is a Swedish voice actor, producer and former director. Berglund is currently working as a music teacher and mentor at Karl Johans school in Örebro, Sweden
Stefan Berglund is a Swedish voice actor, producer and former director. Berglund is currently working as a music teacher and mentor at Karl Johans school in Örebro, Sweden
Lasse Karpmyr is a Swedish translator who mainly translates song lyrics, but has done numerous other translation jobs.
